Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.
The Limitless Network Switch is a unicum not encountered before in any Autonom network, seemingly modified by the Autonom themselves to further enhance their cognitive processing.
Autonom - former robot servants of the Star Union, now turned into a 'sentient' collective.
Seeds such as this one are a rarity. This vessel is shot into space at the end of the Growth's planetary expansion cycle to land on a new world and begin the cycle anew.
Growth - A race of sentient plantlife.

The Imperial Crown is an ancient relic from the days of the Star Union, granted to Prefects held in particularly high esteem. It is the primary symbol of their office. While the Paragon have decayed greatly since those days, they still revere the Crown and the honor it represents above all.
Paragon - remnants of Star Union nobility and military.

Not a device in the conventional sense, this biological construct has many of the Psi-Fish's characteristics, yet it is unlike any of them. What strain of Psi-Fish is capable of generating this creature, or what its exact purpose is remains an enigma. What is certain, however, is that it is capable of 'summoning' other Psi-Fish to it, seemingly generating a connection between it and the Void.
Psi-fish - A race of psionic jellyfish

This strange item isn't a physical object at all, but a string of code, some digital proof of merit that the Spacers seem to hold in exceptionally high regard. Upon closer examination there is no secret powers hidden within the code, it is nothing but an impossible to replicate 'key' without a lock. Its influence when negotiating with the Spacers, however, is undeniable.
Spacers - survivors of the Cataclysm obsessed with virtual escapism.

It has long been known among Star Union zoologists that the Quartzite convert impure minerals into highly energetic Quartzite crystals, and then sustain themselves off the energy of these crystals, hoarding them to maintain a steady supply. This particular example is extraordinarily pure, likely the result of an ancient Quartzite Worm having consumed an exceptionally massive amount of energy in a particular cycle.
Quartzite - a wildlife species of mineral creatures.

Psionica are theorized by many experts to be an offshoot species of the Quartzite. While this theory certainly has merit, the type of crystalline structure the Psionica form is different in a particularly key aspect: whereas the Quartzite species store Thermal or Electric energy, the Psionica seem to somehow process pure Psionic energy. The most crucial difference, however, is their origin and purpose: Psionica are unable to gain sustenance from mineral consumption like their Quartzite 'cousins', instead deriving sustenance from the Psionic energy of biological prey. The crystals that Psionica shed are merely a storage mechanism intended to sustain them through times where live prey is rare.
Psionica - Species of mineral creatures that store and use Psionic energy.

Mycelians form networked connections with other clusters nearby, gaining power from each other's presence. This particular sample is unusually strong, trying to reach out and form connections even from its containment. Scientists theorize this behavior could be used to attract and perhaps even control Mycelian creatures.
Mycelians - a wildlife group of creatures, fungus overgrown machinery.

This mantis claw is peculiar in several ways, most strikingly of which is that it seems to predate the perceived age of the creature it was found attached to by several hundred years. This suggests that this particular specimen renewed itself many times and implies a significantly longer lifetime for the species than was thus far assumed. This particular claw, along with being ancient, also produces a striking sound when stridulated. Its effect has been tested on captive Hopperhounds and the results promise a deeper insight into the species and how it may be controlled.
Hopperhounds - wildlife creatures akin to giant grasshoppers.

This unsettling artifact was not of our creation. It was found like this in one of the Xenopenguin Hives, radiating an unsettling energy. The strange artifact seems to grant the most disturbing visions when touched.

This device, while similar to that of the Oathbound Seers, is clearly corrupted since it constantly spews seemingly random predictions and commands. Whether the Apostates truly follow these devices' commands or simply keep them as a testament to the perceived betrayal of the Seers remains to be seen.
Oathbound - a faction of arthurian knights led by Seers, attempting to build a utopia

Though not quite literally a 'Casket', its morbid purpose still earns its name. It is a device meant to store souls, and it is theorized its original purpose was to recover the 'Essence' of any Heritors whose support systems were failing in order to reincarnate them in the future. The Forgotten curse, however, has seen these devices corrupted beyond this: now they only take, storing Essence without discrimination, creating a horrifying 'soup' of souls that can never be reborn.
Forgotten - Ancient Heritor constructs that have decayed and gone mad.

Terratech holds responsibility for most of the Star Union's altered biology. Having had a large stake in agricultural sectors, they developed techniques to create animals that would grow to exceptional sizes with minimal energy intake, effectively solving any food crisis for the foreseeable future. However, these creatures were volatile, and since the Union's collapse, they have picked up traits beyond what their creators could have intended. This splicer is a testament to that madness.
Terratech - bio corp that the amazons originated from.

RPR detachments are a rare sight in the Star Union, only loyal to their programming that predates even the Star Union. Created to hunt down and destroy Heritor sanctums, each planet's RPR units were slaved to a singular 'Inquisitor' AI. This particular artifact is an AI core containing one such AI, and though heavily damaged and nearly incoherent, it could be instrumental in controlling these ruthless weapons.
RPR - or 'Reapers', a wildlife group of robots that seek to wipe out all traces of the Heritors.
Misfortune - name of a psionic cat.

Black cats have been a symbol of misfortune long before mankind spread to the stars. The Misfortune may give those superstitions some merit at last. A powerful Psionic creature of feline appearance, Misfortunes are surprisingly intelligent and delight in causing mischief and chaos. Misfortunes hunt through deception, Psionically short-circuiting the signals sent from the target's senses. These sporadic signals cause lapses in judgment often mistaken for 'bad luck', forcing their victims to miss otherwise sure shots or simply trip when attempting to make their escape, leaving them easy prey for the creature's claws.

These antlers supposedly belonged to the mysterious and charismatic first leader of the Therians, called "Deer". It is hard to tell if the Therians will worship the carrier of a trophy made out of their popular hero - or if they will despise him and attack! Likely, there is only one way to find out...
Deer - founder of the Therian 'cult' Therians - a faction of animalistically mutated pirates with cult-like tendencies.

Resonance glands are used by Thundermaws to generate their sonic attacks. On an adult Thundermaw in its prime, the glands are capable of producing a roar loud enough to be heard across continents. But such examples of the creature are rare due to their extreme aggression, fierce internal competition and slow aging, leaving precious few of the creatures to reach their prime age.

It is said that when the true Emperor of the Star Union returns, he will sit on this throne. The elite of the Paragon will rally to his protection and proof to the rest of the galaxy why their empire had the military might to last for millenia.

The Grail of Law, like it's counterparts is of unknown origin. Encrypted in a forgotten language, the apparatus functions in ways that have proven to elude modern scientific theory. This particular grail's matrix is structured and rigid, a flawless program that demands those that desire it's wisdom to obey it's laws.[br/][abilityblue][ProductionSector/]Production Specializations generate {Incomebonus}[production/] Income[/abilityblue]

The Grail of Unity is a mystery, like its counterparts, and this particular grail seems to house vast works of philosophy and social science from species and worlds never before heard of. However, it seems to be Encrypted in a wealth of languages, each more alien than the next.[br/][abilityblue][ResidentialSector/]Residential Specializations generate {Incomebonus} Income per [population/] in [foodslot/],[energyslot/],[productionslot/],[researchslot/] or [happinessslot/].[/abilityblue]

The Grail of Life has proven especially unusual, and the research team prodding into its secrets claims it shows signs of life itself. An unknowable matrix generating and encrypting new data constantly while overwriting the old, it holds an incredible library of data on all life it has recorded, as the research team discovered when they decrypted its newest entry: scientist.[br/][abilityblue][SupplySector/]Food Specializations generate {Incomebonus}[food/] Income[/abilityblue]

The Grail of Knowledge appears to be the largest of the 'Grail' devices. It is still constantly growing, but the rate of growth is slow. The research team suspects that exposing it to too much new information could result in the device growing out of control, but the theory is yet to be tested. While it surely holds great wisdom, it also holds an incredible amount of 'junk' data - who ever wanted to know a Quartzite's favorite mineral?[br/][abilityblue][ResearchSector/]Research Specializations generate {Incomebonus}[research/] Income[/abilityblue]

The Grail of Potential is unique among its kind due to its constant flux. It seems to store data like its counterparts, but data is constantly rewritten, moved, added or deleted. The only constant in the device seems to be change, and while this makes it a poor source of data, its energy potential seems to be near limitless...[br/][abilityblue][EnergySector/]Energy Specializations generate {Incomebonus}[energy/] Income[/abilityblue]
